Reviews.Title: “charming and romantic”
Reviews.Author: Margaret S
Reviews.Content: reserve for two standar rooms and finally stayed at a suite, lovely, spacious, charming and so comfortable, with a nice decor with mexican and modern style! lovely gardens and pool. extremely clean and very well located!

Reviews.Title: “great location and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Alicia s
Reviews.Content: stayed for 3 night, we really enjoyed the hotel, it was lovely with a special charm.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kathy H
Reviews.Content: We loved this small , comfortable and boutique hotel, We don´t like very much to stay at all inclusive hotel since these kind of hotel are much more romantic, and presonalized service!, at Hotel Las Golondrinas we stayed 5 nights and really enjoyed them, we went to the beach club which is playa mamitas and stayed there for about 3 or more hours 3 days, this hotel is very closed to 5th Ave in Playa del Carmen, rooms are perfect sized, clean, nice decor, petty gardens, nice pool deck and to be shorter, NICE HOTEL! we of course recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if you don't mind walking a few extra blocks”
Reviews.Author: Klipzlskim
Reviews.Content: This place was terrific. Very attractive, comfortable and clean, great service, good price, easy parking (they have a couple of spots right outside that were usually free), relaxing indoor pool, and free internet in the lobby. Our room was cool and quiet. It’s a bit farther than some from the beach (6-7 blocks) but Playa is all about walking anyway.

Reviews.Title: “STAY OUT: BED BUG INFESTED!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: katiuska15
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located and nice. This being said, the AC automatically changed each night into fan mode.... I woke up every day sweating... but that's nothing compared to the BED BUGS! My friends ad I ALL have bites ALL over our bodies! It's disgusting!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay At This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fun2travelCanberra
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at this hotel there was a gang of thieves going through the rooms. They posed as hotel staff and entered guests rooms by trying to explain to guests about the facilities in the room. While guests were distracted by one person, another person would steal anything available. The hotel reception staff didn't seem friendly. The hotel seems old, the rooms are very old, the lock on our hotel room door didn't work properly. The window in the bathroom was broken. The furnishings in the room were old and outdated. Some guests complained loudly about the service in the restaurant but we at least got some food. There are much better hotels than this one in Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Great individual hotel!”
Reviews.Author: wendyjs59
Reviews.Content: We booked over the internet after a bit of research. Wanted something smallish, not in the main drag and something looking less like the huge commercial anonymous resort type hotels nearer the beach where you could've been anywhere in the world. We stayed for about 2 weeks and used it as a base to get out and about interspersed with recuperative days spent on the beach! We were not disappointed!. The hotel had a Mexican feel about it, typically Mexican vibrant colours, full of little individual nooks and crannies to sit and read, dip in the [choice of] 2 beautiful pools in either full sun or shade depending on what you wanted and the time of day. Everywhere was immaculately clean and spotless, all the staff were friendly and helpful with a sense of humour. Although the hotel doesn't have it's own restaurant, breakfast was no problem as it was served in the adjacent restaurant by exchanging a voucher given at reception - breakfast was great, fresh fruit, scrambled eggs, bacon, ham, pancakes, toast, cereal, juice, tea or coffee. The hotel is situated on a busy corner, about 5 mins from 5th Ave and about 10 mins walk to the beach. We didn't eat at the adjacent restaurant other than breakfast as there's just so much delicious variety and diversity to suit all pockets within easy strolling reach. The nearest ATM and Bank is 5 minutes down the road. We didn't notice the traffic noise if there was any! All the rooms open onto a pretty internal open courtyard or walkways and the building is 3 stories high [ground, 1st and 2nd floors]. Our room was on a corner, it was light and airy as it had windows on both elevations, some of the other rooms we glanced in whilst passing looked as if they could be a bit dark. Our suite had 2 rooms [but only 1 with air con] each with a queen size bed and with a central shared shower room. It had a safe [deposit for special padlock at reception], a TV but we didn't watch it as we were usually out and about. The only down side of our room/s was other than the beds and a chair at the desk there was no comfy chairs to sit in to read or just slouch for a bit. There is also free internet access, free iced drinking water from a cooler by reception, a giant superstore just round the corner for bits and pieces and an amazing Italian deli/small restaurant [Sabrinas] for takeaway delicious rolls, sweet and savoury pastries for lunch or for trips out. The hotel do organise trips, but we didn't try them and accessed the sights independently, so I can't comment about them or their value. If you like to explore a country a bit less like a tourist, then I'd recommend using the "Communale" which is a sort of cross between a taxi and a bigger bus or coach system. They are a fleet of [I think?, State owned?] minibuses which run from Playa to the surrounding larger towns, local people use them to get to/from work, they run all day from early in the morning till late at night and run about every 10-15mins, they only cost about the equivalent of £2 each for a 45 min journey. There are dozens of stops along the highway, you just flag them down and if there's spaces on board then the driver will stop, if not you've only got a short wait til the next one. We experienced a selection of these from very clean, neat, newish with air con to older hot vehicles where you just have the windows open!. Quite a fun, safe way to travel! Ask at reception where the "Communale" Playa pick up point is - their livery is white van with light blue or red flash along the sides, great way to get to Tulum or Cancun and back again [not to the airport - no room for big luggage]. General Mexico travel tip here! - It didn't affect us, as we only had Pesos, but we noticed that all the State/Government ancient archaeological sites will only accept Pesos, not USD. Many of the more expensive restaurants appear to accept either currency, most also appeared to want to know where you're staying if you use a credit card, debit cards seem to be OK. The only down side to the hotel and that's being really picky! would be that we weren't expecting such a hard bed! It took us a couple of nights to get used to it, after which we both slept like logs!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, but with some downside”
Reviews.Author: mamabookworm
Reviews.Content: My husband, my teenage daughter and I spent a week at Hotel Las Golondrinas. We enjoyed our stay, but the hotel does have some issues. The up side: The hotel is pretty, and it's clean, with one exception (see below). Our room was pretty quiet, although there was a bit of street noise in our daughter's room. The staff is very friendly. We had a package that included breakfast at the attached restaurant--a special menu with fruit, yogurt, cereal, toast, pancakes, scrambled eggs, bacon, ham, juice and coffee. It was good and plentiful, if not gourmet. Breakfast isn't served until 7:00 am, which was cutting it close for a couple of our scheduled tours, but it worked out. The hotel is just a few blocks from the beach. It's only about a block to the bank (to change money), and it's less than a block from the Mega Comercial (Playa's version of WalMart), which was handy when we needed essentials. We were also close to quite a few good, inexpensive restaurants (Un Sobrecito del Fogon, HC) and a more expensive, but very good seafood place, La Pesca. We also enjoyed being away from "the strip," in a less touristy part of Playa. The down side: When we arrived, we were put into a room with a mildew smell that about knocked us over. I contacted the staff, and we were immediately put into a new room, but it troubles me that they would assign anyone to such an unlivable space. Our new room was actually a two-bedroom suite, which was nice, except that only one room had an air conditioner, so the second room stayed pretty warm even when the first was chilly. There was also only one very small TV, though that wasn't an issue for us. Though it was a two-bedroom, the rooms were small and there was only one straight-back chair, so we couldn't really "hang out" in our room comfortably. (The weather was very hot, and the hotel lounge wasn't air conditioned, so it would have been nice to be able to relax in a cool room once in a while.) This being Mexico, the beds were, of course, very hard. My husband and daughter liked them; I didn't. The walk to the beach, though short, can be a bit hair-raising, as there are several busy intersections, and drivers do NOT yield to pedestrians. (One corner sometimes has a traffic cop, but he only looks after the cars, and leaves the pedestrians to fend for themselves!) We actually kind of enjoyed the adventure, but you really do have to look, look, and look again. The hotel offers a reduced-price admission to the Las Mamitas beach club, but the club is a bit of a walk, and when we got there, the umbrellas were all taken, so we didn't use it. We booked one excursion through the hotel, and that was a mistake! I had asked the desk if they could recommend a private tour, so that's what I thought we were getting--but it was a _group_ tour. (I could have gotten a better and less expensive group tour elsewhere.) The tour company, Easy Tour, picks up tourists from various hotels and delivers them to a central location, where they are sorted onto different vans going to their destinations. It was time a time-consuming and confusing process (especially since the driver who picked us up didn't speak any English), and a few guests felt that they didn't get the tour they had asked for. We did have fun on the tour, but we didn't really get what we thought we were paying for. All in all, we had a great vacation, though I'm not sure I'd choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Pure bliss”
Reviews.Author: ApatheticAlbertan
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here from Dec 19th - January 4th for the holidays. We didn't know what to expect as neither of us had ever stayed here. We arrived really late, as our flight in Cancun didn't land until midnight. There was someone waiting for us at the front desk who helped us with our immense amounts of luggage (scuba gear). There's no elevators, so if you are of limited mobility, I would recommend requesting a room on the first floor. We wanted to upgrade to a suite while we were there, so we'd have a kitchenette available to us, but the front desk staff said they couldn't accommodate us with one for the entire duration (we'd have to move to a suite for a few days, then back to a regular room, then back to a suite). So we decided to just go with a regular room and we'd buy a styrofoam cooler for the beer! On our first morning out, we returned to find they had found us a mini-fridge to be used while we were there for no extra charge! How nice! The staff made some of the cutest and most inventive towel art I've ever seen. They do a great job at keeping the place spotless. Book with them for the taxi ride to and from the airport, though. If you do the private car, you'll save almost $80 usd over the service from the airport. They have free wifi available and a small computer area in the lounge. The wifi is really good, it just resets itself every 20 minutes or so, so don't plan on streaming any video while you're there. ;) There's two pools available. While I was studying in the lounge area beside the main pool, I noticed lots of little lizards and geckos in the foliage. They're so cute! You need to keep your eyes peeled for them. The pools are hardly ever used though, since the hotel is a 5 minute walk to the beach! Not only that, but of course it's only 5 minutes to the famed 5th ave shopping district. What a vibrant little area. It's also just a block away from the Mega Pelican, if you need to shop for sunscreen or snack foods or beverages. It's a very convenient location. I only ate at the restaurant once, but wasn't a huge fan. I would take that with a grain of salt, considering I'm a really picky eater. Oh, and if you scuba dive, check out the phantom divers dive shop, I did my open water cert with them and they are wonderful! They do on-request centoes, shark and night diving.

Reviews.Title: “peaceful and immaculate”
Reviews.Author: wallers3
Reviews.Content: This hotel was immaulate,and was gorgous. The lobby was like walking into a beatiful museum. the tile and decorations were perfect. the court yard was beautiful with natural flora and fauna, the different shaped pool with perfect blue tile was very appealing. The rooms were equipped with air conditioner and ceiling fans and the tile was like glass so clean and beautiful. Front desk staff very knowlegable of area and attractions and restaurant on site was delicious and also clean and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “I book my reservation online for 4 adults...”
Reviews.Author: Vanholls
Reviews.Content: I book my reservation online for 4 adults and I got an standard room instead of the suite, this wasn't the worst part we got the std. room the air conditioner was broke, the specifications said 2 queen size beds, we only get one queen and one individual and we were 4 people . The host at the reception has to do everything he fix our air condioner, our bathroom, our door , the "submanager" Lic. candy or something waas soo busyy to solve our problems....Well not a good hotel at all

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, warm, clean and welcoming hotel - in quiet area”
Reviews.Author: ZAZA_UK
Reviews.Content: Location: For 11 nights I stayed at Las Golondrinas: the hotel is 5 min walk to the beach and 1 block from the main tourist street of 5 Ave. There are various restaurants where the locals eat scattered on the same road and around, there is a huge supermarket/mall called Mega 1 minute walk on the same road. Summary: ideally located away from the main noise of 5 Ave but central to everything you need. Services: As I needed to study Spanish, I asked for a quiet room and this was obliged. The linen is washed daily unless you place a sign for 'save water' on the bed. The rooms are thoroughly cleaned, and overlook the central courtyard/pool. TV, hairdryer and safety deposit box included. Internet is free at Reception. Improvements: lighting, I agree with earlier comments that the lighting in the rooms are quite poor. Also, the pool is in the central courtyard and does not receive much sunlight hence sunbathers best go to the beach. Breakfast: Served at the adjacent restaurant: apart from the fruit, there was a lack of healthier options: cakes, yoghurt for cereals such as cornflakes, cheerios and rice crispies, and small slices white bread. The coffee is very weak. However, they do offer lovely pancakes known as 'hotcakes' and for a tiny fee of 10 Mexican pesos you can order scrambled eggs - well worth it. Again the service was excellent. Overall: As a single female, I would definitely return and stay at Las Golondrinas. Candy and Lucrecia work in the mornings and are extremely helpful. Arturo does the evening shift and provided many tips for me. Thanks to all of them.

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: chr62
Reviews.Content: We had a good holiday at Las Golondrinas and would happily return .Staff very nice .

Reviews.Title: “Spotlessly clean, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: eljaygee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Las Golondrinas from 10-24th Jan 2010. I cannot praise this hotel enough, it was really clean, and the staff were friendly and helpful, particularly Arturo and Alejandro. I found the Tapas bar attached (used for breakfasts) were keen to adapt to my dietary requirements ( I don't eat sugar), and were happy to prepare other foods for me, for a charge of about 10 pesos (50p approx) The maid service was fantastic (Esperanza) and although I know people have mentioned how nice it was having towels folded into different shapes etc, the impact as a guest made you feel welcomed and cared about. Any problems I had were quickly resolved and I felt well tended by the staff. I would definitely recommend it. Local Restaurants well wrth a look are round the corner on 30th Ave (turn right at the Farmacia) are Nativo, amazing juice bar, good, cheap food, El Fogon, esp opposite Mega, and Tacos Diaz, a bit out of town, but cheap and yummy. I travelled as a solo traveller and felt safe to walk around alone even late at night. Friends of Bill W can meet daily at 5.30-6.30, and M-F 12-1 on 25th Ave and between calle 4-6. I had an amazing time, and would recommend this place to everyone, I'd go back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “If i come back to Playa del Carmen again, definately will stay in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maria_sssss
Reviews.Content: Our Mexico trip started with Playa del Carmen. And we were lucky t stay in Las Golondrinas hotel. The hotel is really cozy....felt at home! What we've liked the most is the hotel's staffl!They were really helpful, advised how to get to major attractions, when we had some problems with TV they came almost immidiately to assist! Rooms were neatly cleaned every morning, and there were cute swans made of towels:) The decorations are in such a mexican style! Actually i cant remember anything bad about it!!! I would definately advise this hotel!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Puuha
Reviews.Content: The service from the hotel staff was excellent and personal. Especially the older guy, Aleksander, was really helpful and gave us lot of useful information of things to do around Playa. We really appreciated the excellent service! Rooms were clean and well kept. The fridge was a nice bonus. The only drawback was that the room we had was quite dark. It had only one window. The hotel is located little further away from the beach (5-10 min walk to beach), but it is just next to a big supermarket, which was very convinient. Our room was very quiet. All in all, we really enjoyed our stay and we were positively surprised about the hotel. It is excellent value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Las Golondrinas was exactly what we were looking for!”
Reviews.Author: lauraleemodesitt
Reviews.Content: I traveled with a large group of people on an educational tour and the staff at Hotel Las Golondrinas was very friendly and helpful. We were with a large group for two nights but decided to extend our stay three additional nights after the group departed. The hotel is beautiful; it literally has trees and plants in the small open area where the pool is. At night it is so pretty with their decorative lights that hang over the pool and in the trees. The rooms open up to this beautiful area. The hotel has a nice breakfast available in the mornings. The teenagers especially liked the free internet and computer use in the lobby. The hotel is approximately 4-5 blocks from the beach but 1-2 blocks from Myers (grocery store/department store). The people that worked the front desk spoke english and were very helpful with informing us about the area and travel tips. The rooms were very clean, had air conditioning, cable tv, had a bottle of water each day, free water in entry, and the maids always made our towels into different designs each day (like a cruise). Playa del Carmen is a wonderful place to visit the locals are extremely nice. Always bargain, never pay the first price! We loved the area and will definitely go back to Hotel Las Golondrinas! My husband threatened to lose our passports, so we could stay.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: walkerhill
Reviews.Content: A great small hotel in an ideal location just 5 min walk from main 5th Avenue. Rooms were kept exceptionally clean and the staff at reception were friendly and very helpful. Air conditioning was efficient, Tv with 100 plus channels. Continental breakfast was more than adequate. The real plus point for me was the peace and quite throughout the day and night. If you want noisy day/night entertainment and people gorging themselves at meal times then this is not for you! The rooms could be improved by the addition of a small fridge. Whilst it did not bother me the absence of a balcony or terrace may be a negative aspect for some. I was in resort to Scuba dive so this was more of a base and for me couldn't be faulted. If you do not wish to eat out there is a large Walmart 2 mins from hotel where you can buy excellent hot/cold food/meals to take out I would have no hesitation in returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “mexico 2009”
Reviews.Author: stefanopater
Reviews.Content: Exellent hotel,to be a 3 stars htl the service was great, special thanks to Roberta that was very helpfull for our stay. the hotel is very clean and close to the center of Playa del Carmen. very well equipped. i will come back !!!! stefano paterlini

Reviews.Title: “Should be called La Cucaracha”
Reviews.Author: TripTrotterNY
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good looking on the outside and the garden around the pool is great too...but it attract bugs. I went with a group of 7 ppl, two rooms. The people in room 101 had to switch two times because of an infestation of roaches in the room. They finally were clear of dead roaches when they got moved to the 3rd floor. Hotel service is good & timely. The pool is far from a real pool - only 3 feet deep throughout. There is also an adult pool which is even smaller. If you are going here, try and e-mail management on their website for a room on the 3rd floor away from the bugs. The rooms are also more updated, flat screen, better AC, larger rooms. Overall, location is great...close enough to the 5th avenue and beach, decent enough service, but overpriced for a placed infested with bugs.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth a try”
Reviews.Author: SouthWalesUKHeather
Reviews.Content: Returned today from this hotel and I would recommend it as a good value and well placed hotel. Yes it is several blocks from the beach and at the edge of the tourist belt - in a straight walk to nearest beach it's about a 10 minute flat stroll. To Mamita's the beach club where Las Golondrinas has discounted rates it's a bit further (ask at reception for a voucher). 5th Avenue where all the touristy stuff is is about 3-4 minutes stroll but there are other good eateries away from there cheaper and filled with locals(5th avenue restaurants are not extortionate - about £25 max for 2 with wine) . The room (we had a suite with 2 bedrooms, bathroom, living/dining space and 'kitchen') was clean, the housekeeping was superb - clean bedding and towels every day and great attention to details. Bedrooms had air con units and all rooms had fans. The balcony referred to in details is not a private one for each room but a corporate one for the whole floor. Yes there is a road on one side but there is no reason to open the window and it isn't dreadful by any means, The breakfast was lovely - lots of fresh fruits, pancakes, toast, coffee etc and a range of teas. The cooker and cooking equipment was basic in the extreme but the microwave and fridge were good quality and efficient (a kettle would have been welcome). Fresh bottled water provided daily and a dispenser by pool which was a haven of shade and quietness. Wi fi available freely was a great bonus and a PC for guests' use in reception. We booked the hotel and transfer with Cancun dot com which used Best Day Travel who were helpful and efficient and we paid a very reasonable price for the hotel through them.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced and clean”
Reviews.Author: MexicoTraveler67
Reviews.Content: Las Golondrinas is a good option if your budget is limited. The rooms have been remodeled and are very comfortable. This hotel is typical of most hotels oriented toward Mexican family accomodations. There is a breakfast buffet that is complimentary and it is quite good. The only drawback that we have had in our 3 visits to Las Golondrinas is that it is a bit of a hike to the beach--approximately 4-5 blocks. I guess we like it, we keep going back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but a little noisy”
Reviews.Author: SCbeachgirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Las Golondrinas for 3 nights, March 9-12. We had requested a room with two beds in it as it was a friend of mine and myself. We were quoted $85 US per night. Went to check-in they told us the room was not quite ready but were happy to hold our bags for us. After returning, we checked in to our room and found that we had gotten a two bedroom suite with a two bedrooms, bathroom, living room, dining area and kitchen. Place was very clean, staff extremely nice. Had a problem with the toilet and it was fixed very promptly. The only grief I had was taht it was a little noisy at night from the cars on Constituyentes. Our room was at the front of the hotel and we slept with the windows open. it was not so loud you could not sleep by any means just could hear traffic, sirens, etc. i would definitely stay here and recommend this hotel to someone else. The hotel website shows the location between 10 and 15 avenue but it is actually between 15 and 20 avenues. It was a quick walk down Constituyentes & 5th. For the price it was more than I was asking for.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: Beatrice12
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel on New Year's Eve 2008. We'd been staying at another place near Cancun and decided to come to Playa for New Year's Eve. We were worried about finding a place because of the holiday so we booked online and really got ripped off on the price. We paid $186 for a suite that was right by the front door and looked out onto the parking lot of a large grocery store. The next morning we also found out that the room didn't come with the continental breakfast (just juice, coffee, yogurt and cereal--Corn Flakes and Coco Puffs). The room was clean and the staff were friendly but the the quality is average--we shouldn't have paid more than $70. It's about 5 blocks from the beach on a really busy street--so it's also quite noisy from the traffic. The pool looks clean and is surrounded by plants with a garden-like atmosphere but it's really small and boxed in by the hotel so there's virutally no sunlight. There's also nowhere to really sit or lounge around. As we walked around later that night we found a few more hotels with about the same level of quality at much more affordable rates and closer to the beach. Don't waste your money here...hold out for something better.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, comfortable and quiet”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Managed to get amazingly cheap last min deal on 'allocated on arrival' accomodation in Playa Del Carmen We were a bit worried at first when the bus stopped off at all the swish resorts on the coast but were miles away from any other civilization and were very pleasently surprised when we got to Las Golondrinas as the hotel is no more than 10 mins (max) walk into Playa del Carmen main street and beach which is fantastic The hotel itself is fairly basic but clean and quiet. Our room was huge with 2 large double beds just for the 2 of us. the a/c was ok but the room was back facing so was in the shade anyway. The swimming pool is pretty tiny and the Breakfast wasn't up to much more than toast & tea but we weren't expecting any more than this. so in a nutshell - nothing special on the hotel, but clean, quiet and convenient for it's * rating and price.

Reviews.Title: “Loves it !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Las Golondrinas Hotel is a very charming one. The patio is really cute, and peaceful with the pool and the sound of the fountain and very beautiful at night with the lights on the trees. The hotel is kept really really clean, the beds are comfy, the area is safe and close to everything. The desk is very helpful. The breakfast buffet is very pleasant as well. I recommand it, 2 thumbs up !

Reviews.Title: “Small, but clean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was the last hotel we stayed at while on the Yucatan Pennisula, and it was about like all the other hotels. The rooms were small, but very clean. The maids were great, if you left a tip, then the left flowers in your room. They were stingy on their towels, and it was impossible to get an extra pillow. The pool was small, but nice, and there wasn't any place to get any sun. The location of this hotel is great!! It was about five minutes of a walk from fifth avenue, the best place in Playa del Carmen to shop, and 10 minutes from beach...Overall it was a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The was a little less than what we were looking for.”
Reviews.Author: pipedope
Reviews.Content: The Pool was small with no areas around it to get any Sun. There was 1 table and 4 chairs downstairs and 1 set upstairs. About 5 streets from the beach. Restarant had free breakfast (toast, fruit, cereal, coffee, juice, ect.) every morning for guests. Restruant has kitchen, but never saw them serve anything else. A bar is in the resturant, never saw any one having a drink. The Front Desk was very helpful. The rooms were clean, beds were to hard for me. We stayed in a suite, 2 bedrooms with a kitchen, fridge, stove and dishes. Hotel is walking distance from everything. We told the desk it would be nice if we could make coffee in our room. When we got to our room there was a new coffee maker.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Las Golondrinas
HotelInfo.Address: Av.Constituyentes 178, entre av 15 y 20 | col centro, Playa del Carmen 77710, Mexico
